eneter.messaging.messagingsystems.messagingsystembase
Interface IDuplexOutputChannel

public interface IDuplexOutputChannel

Declares the duplex output channel that can send messages to the duplex input channel and receive response messages. Notice, the duplex output channel works only with duplex input channel and not with input channel.

Method Summary
 void closeConnection()
          Closes the connection with the duplex input channel.
 Event<DuplexChannelEventArgs> connectionClosed()
          The event is invoked when the connection with the duplex input channel was closed.
 Event<DuplexChannelEventArgs> connectionOpened()
          The event is invoked when the connection with the duplex input channel was opened.
 java.lang.String getChannelId()
          Returns the id of the duplex input channel where messages are sent.
 java.lang.String getResponseReceiverId()
          Returns response receiving id of the duplex output channel.
 java.lang.Boolean isConnected()
          Returns true if the duplex output channel is connected to the duplex input channel and listens to response messages.
 void openConnection()
          Opens the connection with the duplex input channel.
 Event<DuplexChannelMessageEventArgs> responseMessageReceived()
          The event is invoked when a response message was received.
 void sendMessage(java.lang.Object message)
          Sends the message to the address represented by ChannelId.
 

Method Detail

responseMessageReceived

Event<DuplexChannelMessageEventArgs> responseMessageReceived()
The event is invoked when a response message was received. Notice, this event is invoked in a different thread. The exception is only the Synchronous messaging that invokes this event in the thread calling the method SendResponseMessage.

connectionOpened

Event<DuplexChannelEventArgs> connectionOpened()
The event is invoked when the connection with the duplex input channel was opened. Notice, the event is invoked in a thread from the thread pool.

connectionClosed

Event<DuplexChannelEventArgs> connectionClosed()
The event is invoked when the connection with the duplex input channel was closed. Notice, the event is invoked in a thread from the thread pool.

getChannelId

java.lang.String getChannelId()
Returns the id of the duplex input channel where messages are sent. It represents the address where messages are sent. The channel id represents the communication address. The syntax of the channel id depends on the chosen communication. If the messaging is based on http, the address would be e.g.: http://127.0.0.1/Something/ or http://127.0.0.1:7345/Something/. If the communication is based on tcp, the address would be e.g.: tcp://127.0.0.1:7435/.

getResponseReceiverId

java.lang.String getResponseReceiverId()
Returns response receiving id of the duplex output channel. The response receiver id is a unique identifier used by the duplex input channel to recognize connected duplex output channels.

sendMessage

void sendMessage(java.lang.Object message)
Sends the message to the address represented by ChannelId.

openConnection

void openConnection()
Opens the connection with the duplex input channel.

closeConnection

void closeConnection()
Closes the connection with the duplex input channel.

isConnected

java.lang.Boolean isConnected()
Returns true if the duplex output channel is connected to the duplex input channel and listens to response messages.
